title_sort: william h. millis, jr., to walt whitman, 16 february 1874
title: William H. Millis, Jr., to Walt Whitman, 16 February 1874
text: Dover, Delaware,February 16, 1874Dear FriendYour card came to me on the night of the 13th. I was agreeable surprised to think that you had not forgotten me as I shall never forget you as long as I live. My father & mother is still living in Bridge-villeBut myself & my little Family live near the capital of this state. I am married & have one ChildI will be 3 years married in March. I am about as well as I could expect to be under circumstances. You cant[can't] begin to think how proud I felt when I got your card.If you can make it convient[convenient] I would like for you to pay us a visit in May, as we will be better fixed then to accomodate[accommodate] you then[than] we are at present.Hoping this may find you well & also that we may here[hear] from again soon,I remain your &c. William H. Millis, Jr., to Walt Whitman, 16 February 1874
